result.value:
> Uciteli, A.; Beger, C.; Kropf, S.; Herre, H. (2019): Spreadsheet Model Generator (SMOG): A Lightweight Tool for
> Object-Spreadsheet Mapping. In: *Studies in health technology and informatics* 267, pp. 110–117. DOI:
> [10.3233/SHTI190814](https://doi.org/10.3233/SHTI190814).

# Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct

## Our Pledge

In the interest of fostering an open and welcoming environment, we as
contributors and maintainers pledge to making participation in our project and
our community a harassment-free experience for everyone, regardless of age, body
size, disability, ethnicity, sex characteristics, gender identity and expression,
level of experience, education, socio-economic status, nationality, personal
appearance, race, religion, or sexual identity and orientation.

## Our Standards

Examples of behavior that contributes to creating a positive environment
include:

* Using welcoming and inclusive language
* Being respectful of differing viewpoints and experiences
* Gracefully accepting constructive criticism
* Focusing on what is best for the community
* Showing empathy towards other community members

Examples of unacceptable behavior by participants include:

* The use of sexualized language or imagery and unwelcome sexual attention or
 advances
* Trolling, insulting/derogatory comments, and personal or political attacks
* Public or private harassment
* Publishing others' private information, such as a physical or electronic
 address, without explicit permission
* Other conduct which could reasonably be considered inappropriate in a
 professional setting

## Our Responsibilities

Project maintainers are responsible for clarifying the standards of acceptable
behavior and are expected to take appropriate and fair corrective action in
response to any instances of unacceptable behavior.

Project maintainers have the right and responsibility to remove, edit, or
reject comments, commits, code, wiki edits, issues, and other contributions
that are not aligned to this Code of Conduct, or to ban temporarily or
permanently any contributor for other behaviors that they deem inappropriate,
threatening, offensive, or harmful.

## Scope

This Code of Conduct applies both within project spaces and in public spaces
when an individual is representing the project or its community. Examples of
representing a project or community include using an official project e-mail
address, posting via an official social media account, or acting as an appointed
representative at an online or offline event. Representation of a project may be
further defined and clarified by project maintainers.

## Enforcement

Instances of abusive, harassing, or otherwise unacceptable behavior may be
reported by contacting the project team at christoph.beger@imise.uni-leipzig.de. All
complaints will be reviewed and investigated and will result in a response that
is deemed necessary and appropriate to the circumstances. The project team is
obligated to maintain confidentiality with regard to the reporter of an incident.
Further details of specific enforcement policies may be posted separately.

Project maintainers who do not follow or enforce the Code of Conduct in good
faith may face temporary or permanent repercussions as determined by other
members of the project's leadership.

## Attribution

This Code of Conduct is adapted from the [Contributor Covenant][homepage], version 1.4,
available at https://www.contributor-covenant.org/version/1/4/code-of-conduct.html

[homepage]: https://www.contributor-covenant.org

For answers to common questions about this code of conduct, see
https://www.contributor-covenant.org/faq
Spreadsheet Model Generator (SMOG): A Lightweight Tool for Object-Spreadsheet Mapping

parent_header: Spreadsheet Model Generator (SMOG): A Lightweight Tool for Object-Spreadsheet Mapping
result.value:
The SMOG generates Java programming models from annotated Excel templates to read and write spreadsheet data.
Following spreadsheet entities are inter alia supported: Fields, Tables and Trees.
The entities must be annotated with entity identifiers "Field:", "Table:", "TreeTable:" followed by the entity
name (see example.xlsx). Additionally, data types of fields or table values can be specified in the corresponding
title or head cells (e.g., [Integer] or [StringL] for list types). For list types, an additional separator character
can be defined (e.g., [StringL] <;>). The default separator character is "|".

String fields of a *table 1* can be declared as foreign keys to fields of another *table 2*.
This results into methods being generated for the Java class of entries in *table 1* to access all referenced entries in
*table 2*.

The code in this repository, and in contributions provided via pull requests, should conform to
[Google Java Style](https://google.github.io/styleguide/javaguide.html). 
We use the flag `--skip-reflowing-long-strings` for [google-java-format](https://github.com/google/google-java-format),
as it is currently not supported by all IDEs.
Spreadsheet Model Generator (SMOG): A Lightweight Tool for Object-Spreadsheet Mapping

The code in this repository, and in contributions provided via pull requests, should conform to
[Google Java Style](https://google.github.io/styleguide/javaguide.html). 
If you are running Linux and have `google-java-format` installed, you can run the [format](format) script to reformat
all repository files.

result.description:
## What's Changed
* Improve exception handling and reporting by @KonradHoeffner in https://github.com/Onto-Med/SMOG/pull/37
* Rename shaded jar file by @ChristophB in https://github.com/Onto-Med/SMOG/pull/39
* Replace OS-specific line endings in generated files with LF by @ChristophB in https://github.com/Onto-Med/SMOG/pull/40
* Apply some minor code improvements by @ChristophB in https://github.com/Onto-Med/SMOG/pull/41
* enable dependabot GitHub action version updates by @KonradHoeffner in https://github.com/Onto-Med/SMOG/pull/44
* Merge formatting check and test workflows for better efficiency by @KonradHoeffner in https://github.com/Onto-Med/SMOG/pull/46
* enable Dependabot for Maven by @KonradHoeffner in https://github.com/Onto-Med/SMOG/pull/47
* Add metaclass support by @KonradHoeffner in https://github.com/Onto-Med/SMOG/pull/48


### Dependencies
* Bump actions/checkout from 3 to 4 by @dependabot in https://github.com/Onto-Med/SMOG/pull/45
* Bump info.picocli:picocli from 4.7.4 to 4.7.5 by @dependabot in https://github.com/Onto-Med/SMOG/pull/49
* Bump org.slf4j:slf4j-api from 2.0.7 to 2.0.9 by @dependabot in https://github.com/Onto-Med/SMOG/pull/50
* Bump org.slf4j:slf4j-simple from 2.0.7 to 2.0.9 by @dependabot in https://github.com/Onto-Med/SMOG/pull/51
* Bump org.apache.maven.plugins:maven-shade-plugin from 3.5.0 to 3.5.1 by @dependabot in https://github.com/Onto-Med/SMOG/pull/54
* Bump org.apache.poi:poi-ooxml from 5.2.3 to 5.2.4 by @dependabot in https://github.com/Onto-Med/SMOG/pull/53
* Bump commons-io:commons-io from 2.13.0 to 2.14.0 by @dependabot in https://github.com/Onto-Med/SMOG/pull/52
* Bump commons-io:commons-io from 2.14.0 to 2.15.0 by @dependabot in https://github.com/Onto-Med/SMOG/pull/55
* Bump org.apache.logging.log4j:log4j-to-slf4j from 2.20.0 to 2.21.1 by @dependabot in https://github.com/Onto-Med/SMOG/pull/56
* Bump com.fasterxml.jackson.core:jackson-databind from 2.15.2 to 2.15.3 by @dependabot in https://github.com/Onto-Med/SMOG/pull/57
* Bump com.fasterxml.jackson.core:jackson-core from 2.15.2 to 2.15.3 by @dependabot in https://github.com/Onto-Med/SMOG/pull/58
* Bump com.fasterxml.jackson.dataformat:jackson-dataformat-yaml from 2.15.2 to 2.15.3 by @dependabot in https://github.com/Onto-Med/SMOG/pull/59
* Bump actions/setup-java from 3 to 4 by @dependabot in https://github.com/Onto-Med/SMOG/pull/61
* Upgrade dependencies by @ChristophB in https://github.com/Onto-Med/SMOG/pull/67
* Bump com.fasterxml.jackson.core:jackson-annotations from 2.16.0 to 2.16.1 by @dependabot in https://github.com/Onto-Med/SMOG/pull/68
* Bump org.slf4j:slf4j-simple from 2.0.9 to 2.0.10 by @dependabot in https://github.com/Onto-Med/SMOG/pull/69
* Bump org.codehaus.mojo:exec-maven-plugin from 3.1.0 to 3.1.1 by @dependabot in https://github.com/Onto-Med/SMOG/pull/70
* Bump com.fasterxml.jackson.core:jackson-core from 2.16.0 to 2.16.1 by @dependabot in https://github.com/Onto-Med/SMOG/pull/71
* Bump com.fasterxml.jackson.dataformat:jackson-dataformat-yaml from 2.15.3 to 2.16.1 by @dependabot in https://github.com/Onto-Med/SMOG/pull/72
* Bump org.apache.logging.log4j:log4j-to-slf4j from 2.22.0 to 2.22.1 by @dependabot in https://github.com/Onto-Med/SMOG/pull/73
* Bump org.junit.jupiter:junit-jupiter-api from 5.10.0 to 5.10.1 by @dependabot in https://github.com/Onto-Med/SMOG/pull/74
* Bump org.slf4j:slf4j-simple from 2.0.10 to 2.0.11 by @dependabot in https://github.com/Onto-Med/SMOG/pull/75
* Bump org.slf4j:slf4j-api from 2.0.9 to 2.0.11 by @dependabot in https://github.com/Onto-Med/SMOG/pull/76
* Bump com.fasterxml.jackson.core:jackson-databind from 2.15.3 to 2.16.1 by @dependabot in https://github.com/Onto-Med/SMOG/pull/77
* Bump org.apache.logging.log4j:log4j-to-slf4j from 2.22.1 to 2.23.0 by @dependabot in https://github.com/Onto-Med/SMOG/pull/78
* Bump org.apache.maven.plugins:maven-shade-plugin from 3.5.1 to 3.5.2 by @dependabot in https://github.com/Onto-Med/SMOG/pull/79
* Bump org.slf4j:slf4j-simple from 2.0.11 to 2.0.12 by @dependabot in https://github.com/Onto-Med/SMOG/pull/80
* Bump org.slf4j:slf4j-api from 2.0.11 to 2.0.12 by @dependabot in https://github.com/Onto-Med/SMOG/pull/81
* Bump org.codehaus.mojo:exec-maven-plugin from 3.1.1 to 3.2.0 by @dependabot in https://github.com/Onto-Med/SMOG/pull/82

## What's Changed
* Update dependencies by @KonradHoeffner in https://github.com/Onto-Med/SMOG/pull/11
* Set line endings to LF for compatibility across operating systems. Resolve #13. by @KonradHoeffner in https://github.com/Onto-Med/SMOG/pull/14
* Supress log4j error message for tests. Resolves #9. by @KonradHoeffner in https://github.com/Onto-Med/SMOG/pull/12
* Add code style guideline configuration and workflow by @ChristophB in https://github.com/Onto-Med/SMOG/pull/16
* Update Java version 8 to 17 LTS by @KonradHoeffner in https://github.com/Onto-Med/SMOG/pull/15
* Fix workflows by @KonradHoeffner in https://github.com/Onto-Med/SMOG/pull/18
* Add cli by @ChristophB in https://github.com/Onto-Med/SMOG/pull/19
* Fix maven test badge by @ChristophB in https://github.com/Onto-Med/SMOG/pull/25
* Add mvn packaging to cli by @ChristophB in https://github.com/Onto-Med/SMOG/pull/27
* Extend CLI with options to generate RDF/OWL by @ChristophB in https://github.com/Onto-Med/SMOG/pull/28
* Convert some classes to records by @KonradHoeffner in https://github.com/Onto-Med/SMOG/pull/20
* Add link to latest released assets by @ChristophB in https://github.com/Onto-Med/SMOG/pull/29

**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/Onto-Med/SMOG/compare/v1.1.0...v1.2.0

## What's Changed
* Upgrade Apache POI from 4.0.1 to 5.2.3. by @KonradHoeffner in https://github.com/Onto-Med/SMOG/pull/3
* Migrate to from JUnit 4 to JUnit Jupiter 5.9.2. by @KonradHoeffner in https://github.com/Onto-Med/SMOG/pull/4
* Update commons-io to 2.11.0. by @KonradHoeffner in https://github.com/Onto-Med/SMOG/pull/5
* Update OWLAPI to 5.5.0. by @KonradHoeffner in https://github.com/Onto-Med/SMOG/pull/6
* Add version info to generated ontology
* Enable annotations of annotations

## New Contributors
* @KonradHoeffner made their first contribution in https://github.com/Onto-Med/SMOG/pull/3

parent_header: Spreadsheet Model Generator (SMOG): A Lightweight Tool for Object-Spreadsheet Mapping
Spreadsheet Model Generator (SMOG): A Lightweight Tool for Object-Spreadsheet Mapping
result.value:
Download one of our [JAR releases](https://github.com/Onto-Med/SMOG/releases/latest) and run it as shown below
(replace 'x.x.x' with the actual SMOG version):

```sh
# generate Java files in directory 'src/main/java'
java -jar smog-x.x.x-shaded.jar generate --group-id test.model --artifact-id test_artifact --version 0.1.0 example.xlsx src/main/java

# generate Maven package in directory 'lib', default values are used for --group-id, --artifact-id, and --version
java -jar smog-x.x.x-shaded.jar generate --mvn example.xlsx lib

# specify maven home
java -jar "-Dmaven.home=/path/to/maven/home" smog-x.x.x-shaded.jar generate --mvn example.xlsx lib
```

```sh
# perform an OWL export as described in the config.yaml file
java -jar smog-x.x.x-shaded.jar export config.yaml
```

parent_header: Spreadsheet Model Generator (SMOG): A Lightweight Tool for Object-Spreadsheet Mapping
result.value:
| property       | description                                                                   |
|----------------|-------------------------------------------------------------------------------|
| namespace      | namespace to be used for this ontology                                        |
| version        | version of the ontology, see <https://www.w3.org/TR/owl-ref/#versionInfo-def> |
| inputFile      | Microsoft Excel input file                                                    |
| outputFile     | destination of the output file                                                |
| metadata (map) | additional axioms provided as `<property-uri>: [value1, value2, ...]`         |

Example `config.yaml`:

```yaml
---
namespace: http://example.com/ex#
version: 1.0.0
inputFile: example.xlsx
outputFile: example.owl
metadata:
  http://purl.org/dc/terms/title:
    - Example Ontology
```
